description: Request for Proposals (RFP) for Contractors and Suppliers to be placed on the Open Construction Source List (OCSL) for commercial, residential, industrial, institutional, and civil construction in Ottawa and Gatineau.
full_summary:
# Open Construction Source List Opportunity Available for Ottawa/Gatineau Region
## Procurement Announcement

The Government of Canada is inviting contractors and suppliers to apply to be placed on an Open Construction Source List (OCSL) for commercial, residential, industrial, institutional, and civil work required by the Department of National Defence in Ottawa/Gatineau.

## Key Application Details
- Application Period: Open opportunity; submission can be made at any time.
- Pre-qualification Requirements: Multiple, including business and industry-specific requirements.
- Contractor and Supplier Interested Parties: Expected to create a MERX account to receive updated notifications and bid on projects.
- Evaluation Criteria: Subject to pre-qualification requirements and opportunity-specific evaluation criteria.

## Aggregate Contract Details
- Type: Competitive bidding
- Contract Value: Up to $10 million
- Work Locations: Ottawa/Gatineau region
- Contract Duration: Multiple year extensions as negotiated

## Eligibility Criteria
- Contractors and suppliers eligible to participate in the OCSL program may include:
	+ Companies with a demonstrated track record of service delivery in the construction industry.
	+ Suppliers that meet DCC's industry-specific and business requirements for participating in the construction industry.
- All contractors and suppliers interested in participating in the program should review DCC's procurement policies and evaluation criteria to determine suitability.

## What to Expect
- Review and verify bidder information for completeness before accepting bidder packages.
- Bidder registration process and information will be communicated separately.
- Quotations will be evaluated based on the Evaluation Criteria as outlined in the solicitation documents.

## Important Considerations
- Contractors and suppliers selected for participation in the OCSL program, will be required to provide accurate and complete information.
- Performance evaluations will be conducted on an ongoing basis to measure contractor and supplier performance.
- Contractors and suppliers may be removed from the OCSL program for non-compliance or if not demonstrating satisfactory performance.

## Contact Information
- For inquiries and additional information, please contact DCC's MERX representative at:
- Jacob Lachapelle, Lead Procurement Program:
	- Telephone: 343-550-4560
	- Email: [Jacob.Lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:Jacob.Lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca)
- Suppliers and Contractors may also access the procurement information via the MERX website at http://www.merx.com.
Latest updates on tenders, admissibility, and mandatory documents can be found at the same website.
